alert.note: Alert for Apache (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 26 at 6:54PM MST until July 26 at 10:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... the Chuska Mountains in Navajo Nation of northern Apache County, Arizona... * Until 1000 PM MST. * At 649 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the Chuska Mountains including Red Rock, Lukachukai, Tsaile, and Wheatfields. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Cove Chapter House, Red Rock, Sehili, Wheatfields, Upper Wheatfields, Canyon De Chelly National Monument, Twin Falls, Lukachukai, and Tsaile. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Lukachukai Creek, Sheep Dip Creek, Standing Redrock Creek, Lizard Wash, Blackrock Wash, White Rock Wash, Wheatfields Creek, Blackhorse Creek, Greasewood Wash, Tsitah Wash, Whiskey Creek, Horse Mesa Creek, Black Rock Canyon, Teec Nos Pos Wash, Toh Dahstini Wash, Agua Sal Creek, Walker Creek, Muerto, Canyon del and Hasbidito Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
